abstract: Doctors across country are trying to reduce amount of opioids they are prescribing as states and federal government seek to limit use of such drugs that have contributed to epidemic of overdoses and deaths; example of Dr Wergin, primary care physician in Milford, Neb, cited; success of effort to combat addiction crisis in country may well depend on whether doctors can wean their patients off such pills while still managing their chronic pain.
lead_paragraph: A growing number of states are enacting measures to limit prescription opioids, addictive medicines that have led to an epidemic of overdoses and deaths.

headline.main: Patients in Pain, and a Doctor Who Must Limit Drugs
headline.print_headline: His Patients in Pain, a Doctor Must Limit Their Use of Opioids
